meanings.sent1: After the rain, the dry soil started resorbing the water.
meanings.sent2: The sponge was resorbing the spilled milk on the table.
meanings.sent3: The hungry towel seemed to be resorbing all the water in the sink.
meanings.sent4: The desert was resorbing the footprints of the lost travelers.
meanings.sent5: The plant was resorbing the nutrients from the soil to grow taller.

meanings.definition: To take back into the body
meanings.sent1: The body was resorbing the vitamins from the food it had consumed.
meanings.sent2: The skin was resorbing the lotion applied to it.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be resorbing the warmth from the sunbeam.
meanings.sent4: The roots were resorbing the nutrients from the soil to nourish the tree.
meanings.sent5: The cells were resorbing the oxygen to sustain life.

meanings.sent1: The stomach was resorbing the nutrients from the digested food.
meanings.sent2: The ocean was resorbing the dissolved minerals from the rocks.
meanings.sent3: The potion appeared to be resorbing the magical essence of the spell.
meanings.sent4: The paper towel was resorbing the spilled ink on the desk.
meanings.sent5: The roots were resorbing the minerals from the decomposed leaves.
